alert.note: Alert for Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 12:47AM PST until December 27 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Additional ice accumulation of less than one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Number 2 Canyon, Number 1 Canyon, Pangborn Airport, Wenatchee, Entiat, Chelan, and Cashmere. * WHEN...Until 6 AM PST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Portions of the Wenatchee area will remain near or below freezing overnight. Temperatures are expected to gradually climb above freezing Wednesday morning, but until then, roads and sidewalks will be icy. Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
